words.definition: To accomplish something is to finish it successfully.
words.example: I was able to accomplish all my goals.

words.definition: To approve of something is to think that it is good.
words.example: My parents don't approve of my new friend.

words.definition: Approximate means to be close to an exact amount or number.
words.example: The approximate time of the flight is three hours.

words.definition: A barrier is something that is in your way.
words.example: The wall was a barrier that kept us out.

words.definition: To detect something is to notice or find something.
words.example: The dog was able to detect the smell of smoke.

words.definition: A duty is something that a person has to do.
words.example: It is my duty to help my family.

words.definition: If something is elementary, it is simple and basic.
words.example: He is taking an elementary English class.

words.definition: A failure is a situation when something does not work.
words.example: The project was a failure.

words.definition: When something is gradual, it happens slowly.
words.example: The change in the weather was gradual.

words.definition: An immigrant is a person who moves to a new country.
words.example: Many immigrants live in this city.

words.definition: To insert something is to put it in something else.
words.example: He inserted the key into the lock.

words.definition: An instant is a very short amount of time.
words.example: The food was ready in an instant.

words.definition: Poverty is the state of being poor.
words.example: Many people live in poverty in that country.

words.definition: To pretend is to act in a way that is not true.
words.example: The children pretended to be soldiers.

words.definition: A rank is a personâ€™s level in a group.
words.example: He has a high rank in the army.

words.definition: Recognition is getting praise from other people.
words.example: He got recognition for his hard work.

words.definition: To refrigerate is to make something cold.
words.example: You should refrigerate the milk so it doesn't go bad.

words.definition: To rent is to pay money to use something.
words.example: We rent an apartment in the city.

words.definition: To retire is to leave your job usually because of age.
words.example: My father is going to retire next year.

words.definition: A statistic is a number that shows a fact.
words.example: The statistics show that the economy is growing.
